name: Pigeon
overview: Pigeon is a avian reptile currently documented from Holocene (living lineage tracing back to Mesozoic theropod ancestors) in Worldwide (domestic and feral populations). Current interpretation suggests a omnivore feeding profile. It is typically classified as Aves, Neornithes, Columbidae. Evidence quality for Pigeon is currently limited by specimen completeness and historical naming complexity. Dino-pedia tracks this taxon with conservative wording so future specimen-level studies can be integrated without overwriting uncertain claims.

scientificData.period: Holocene (living lineage tracing back to Mesozoic theropod ancestors)
scientificData.discovered: Rock dove described by Linnaeus in 1758; deep dinosaur ancestry established through modern phylogenetics
scientificData.speed: Common sustained flight around 60-80 km/h; can exceed this in bursts

historyOfResearch.birdDinosaurLink: Modern paleontology and cladistics place birds within theropod dinosaurs, especially maniraptoran coelurosaurs.
historyOfResearch.fossilContext: Feathered non-avian dinosaurs and transitional taxa support continuity between classic theropods and birds.
historyOfResearch.modernEvidence: Skeletal homology, nesting behavior, medullary bone, and molecular phylogenetics all support dinosaurian ancestry.

externalAppearance.bodyPlan: Compact body with short neck, small head, and strong flight musculature.
externalAppearance.feathers: Dense contour feathers with high urban-adaptive variation in color morphs.
externalAppearance.beak: Keratinous beak with soft cere; no teeth, unlike earlier avialan and non-avian theropod ancestors.

behaviorAndConflict.socialBehavior: Highly social and flock-forming, with strong site fidelity in urban and cliff environments.
behaviorAndConflict.navigation: Well known for homing ability using multisensory orientation.
behaviorAndConflict.conflict: Most conflict is intraspecific over nesting sites and food patches rather than high-risk combat.

paleoecology.dinosaurLegacy: Pigeons represent the living branch of dinosaur evolution and are an accessible example of deep-time continuity.
paleoecology.coexistingFauna: They coexist with diverse modern vertebrates and thrive in anthropogenic ecosystems.
paleoecology.niche: Generalist urban-adapted forager with high behavioral flexibility.

taxonomyAndBreeds.note: Domestic fancy pigeons are breeds derived mainly from Columba livia, not separate biological species.

funFacts: Every city pigeon is part of a living dinosaur lineage.
Bird respiration and skeletal architecture preserve major theropod evolutionary innovations.
This hidden page exists because Dino-pedia users asked for pigeon representation.

researchContext.evidenceBase: Pigeon is represented by published fossil material, but completeness and diagnostic overlap can limit high-confidence biological reconstruction.
researchContext.currentLimits: Several ecological and life-history traits remain inferential rather than directly measured for this taxon.
researchContext.nextDataNeeded: Priority evidence includes better-preserved cranial/postcranial overlap, robust stratigraphic control, and specimen-linked morphometrics.
researchContext.revisionOutlook: Interpretation is expected to improve as new finds and reanalyses clarify taxonomy and anatomy.
